means: 军事化( militarize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: It was militarized in 1198 and given land in Jerusalem and Germany.
sentence.Network_cn: 1198成为军事组织,并在耶路撒冷和德国拥有领地.

sentence.Network_en: The Middle East is the most militarized region in the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 中东地区是世界上军事化程度最高的地区.

PerfectNetExp.abs: instead , neocons would recommend an aggressive and militarized response to ensure human hegemony .反之，新保守主义势力会建议一种好战的、军国主义化的回应，以确保人的霸权。

entry.def: A militarized area or region has members of the armed forces and military equipment in it.

example.ex: ...the militarized zone that separates the faction leaders' areas of control.
example.tran: 将党派领袖的管制区分隔开的军事化区域

entry.tran: 军事化的(指具有好战性、纪律性等军队特色的)
entry.def: You can use militarized to show disapproval of something that has many military characteristics, for example the quality of being aggressive or strict.

example.ex: ...a militarized and confrontationist style of politics.
example.tran: 具有军事化和对抗主义特色的政治风格
